verses.roman:
ānande vihvala pradyumna, paḍe aśru-dhāra
"hāhā kibā kara" bali' karaye phutkāra

synonyms: ānande vihvala—overwhelmed by transcendental ecstasy; pradyumna—Pradyumna Brahmacārī; paḍe aśru-dhāra—tears fell from his eyes; hāhā—alas, alas; kibā kara—what are You doing; bali'-saying; karaye phut-kāra—began to express disappointment.
translation: Pradyumna Brahmacārī was overwhelmed by transcendental ecstasy upon seeing Caitanya Mahāprabhu eating everything. Thus tears flowed from his eyes. Nevertheless, he expressed dismay, saying,"Alas, alas! My dear Lord, what are You doing? You are eating everyone's food!
